column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////We enjoyed Lou Malnati's
column2: but found the pizza comparable in nearly every respect to that of Pizzeria Uno. It was good
column3: but nothing to write home about. If Lou Malnati's truly is deemed to be among Chicago's best
column4: then we are mystified by the ongoing debate between Chicagoans and New Yorkers regarding who's pizza reigns supreme. I want to make clear that I do not praise New York pizza simply because it's my hometown. I will proudly wave the flag of any pizzeria regardless of the city
column7: or planet from which it came (see my review of Grimaldi's in Tucson)
column8: provided the taste is worthy of such acclaim
column9: but Lou Malnati's simply isn't that good.
